data.title: Unable to pick up our fifty dollars worth of pizza
data.text: We just had a pretty tragic visit to the Aldo's in Rio Rancho. We placed a $50 order an hour early for pickup tonight. When we got there, the restaurant was under water and we waited over 15 minutes in the front of a line of 4 and we couldn't get anyone to make eye contact with us or acknowledge us in any way although we were standing right in front of them. Calls kept coming in and the front desk person kept deciding to avoid all eye contact or help anyone there and instead answered call after phone call. We waited 20 minutes through this and were forced to leave. I felt bad and wanted to let someone know we were cancelling our order. But I didn't want to call them from home and create more delays for all my fellow line waiters. I tried to go to their website and use their contact us form, but that URL displays as a blank page on my iPad or my laptop in Chrome or Firefox. No way to contact them at all - even face to face. My husband is furious and probably won't want to go back which is a shame because they do pretty good NY pizza for ABQ.

data.title: Real New York style Pizza
data.text: Go in for a "Slice", they're huge!! Great for variety...if you're wanting New York Style Pizza...Aldo's is a good place to go!! Very small restaurant, however I love that it's a family owned and operated business!!

data.title: Italian Stallion Preference
data.text: I have enjoyed pizza from Aldo's formerly Venezia's for more than 30 years. It has been excellent every time. I prefer the Large Italian Stallion.

user_location.name: Rio Rancho, New Mexico, United States

data.title: Famuly dinner
data.text: Nice selection of pizzas and other Foods they're very family-oriented nice to have a place where the food is very good price as well within budget for a family and a nice relaxed atmosphere

data.title: No thanks
data.text: Run by kids who are rude (they probably don't realize it, however). Management doesn't care. Customer service sucks.

data.title: Great NY Style pizza
data.text: If you want flat New York style pizza this is the place to go. Its very affordable and they have a pizza so big we have to place it in our trunk it wont make it thru the doors.

data.title: Reeks of Indifference
data.text: I gave this place a poor review the last time I was there... it used to be a place I liked quite a bit, but the pizza got worse and worse.  I thought I'd try again.  The pizza was as mediocre as ever... way to doughy... half the volume of the pizza was dough... sauce and cheese without any character.  I'm tough to please, I admit it... former New Yorker with high expectations of a place that advertises NY Pizza.  In the several times I've gone back since last review... the place is dingier than ever, and the people working there seem to care less whether you are enjoying their pizza or not.  Gimme the money I'm done with you.  Pizza was not hot enough to my taste... it felt like I was putting out the woman at the counter to ask her to heat it up some more.  Handed it back to me, never asked if it was to my liking.  Take your business to a place with better pizza, better atmosphere and staff that gives a hoot.

data.title: Rio Rancho's only pizza by the slice!
data.text: The calzones have too much dough. The pizzas are ordinary. But, they are only only place in Rio Rancho that offers slices! In good weather, they have two outside tables. Always plenty to read in the newsstand. Sometimes the slices are cold. Be careful! They come out of the oven piping hot - too hot for me, so, I always tell them just to heat them for a few minutes, instead of going through the full rack. Bit pricey, too, compared to the chains: Little Caesar, Domino's, Papa Johns and Pizza Hut.

data.title: Slices are the best part! Hardly anyone sells them here!
data.text: The slices available are the best part. Their other food is quite ordinary, but, if you just want 2 slices, well, here you go!

data.title: What happened!   Worst pie ever
data.text: I am shocked! When the ownership changed here so did the quality of the my slice. My great disappointment here is quality and taste of the pie I orders tonight. A $2 frozen pizza is a several steps above this Italian Stallion pie I wish in did pay $23 for and attempt to eat. I never had a BLAND pizza with a real bad frozen pizza quality crust before. I eat pizza twice a week and Use to eat here at least once per week.  No more! This was a bad frozen pie not anything close to a NY slice. Avoid this place.

data.title: Best Pizza In ABQ Area
data.text: If you are ever visiting Albuquerque or in the Rio Rancho, this is the place for you!  This is the pizza from the famous Breaking Bad series (the one Walter throws on the roof)!  We always get this pizza and it never disappoints!  They have a small dining room to sit down, but most people pick up for take-out.  It is well worth it and very cost effective!

data.title: Good slice
data.text: If your looking for a NY slice in Rio Rancho, try Aldo's. Good pie. Not great but good. Parmigiana heroes are good and the calzone is ok. The 24 inch pizza is real good. The staff could be a little more attentive.

data.title: Great pizza
data.text: Ordered small pizza, and they made it half cheese, and half other toppings we wanted. Also got an order of bread sticks..everything was delicious and reasonably priced.  Pizza is thick with just the right amount of sauce and lots of cheese.  Delivery takes about 45 minutes or more, so we did carryout.  You can also dine in.  Great online ordering website.  We ordered and paid online.

data.title: Downhill into a cheese morrass
data.text: I used to like this place.  It's not NY Pizza no matter what they say and neither is anything else in New Mexico, but they used to get closer.  I don't usually indulge in unnecessarily harsh reviews, but what in the world are they using for cheese these days.... flavoress, taffy like substance... too much of it... barely any tomato sauce.... had a one topping 'special pizza' and had to go prospecting to find my anchovies.  Half the pizza is thick doughy not quite cooked crust without any cheese or sauce.  I guess I shouldn't complain since the cheese was so bad.  I'll go back and hope they redeem themselves because it's convenient... but definetley not my go to place for pizza.

data.title: Customer is always wrong?
data.text: Hands down worst customer service EVER!  Ordered online and received the wrong item. Manager made no offer to remedy... But did offer up a healthy order of bad attitude.  Blamed my computer even though I had a receipt proving what I ordered.  Had to drive to the location for refund.  Then they tried to stiff me on tax-.-  food is not worth the trouble and the place is dirty.

data.title: Just say no!
data.text: Horrible customer service and a dirty environment.  They messed up our order and then had the nerve to blame us.  That's the worst customer service I have ever encountered.

data.title: Went to the downtown location
data.text:
Well many things can go awry with a pizza place... This one takes the cake, the gold star, AND the dunce cap! 

So the place was dirty! They announce to everyone that they are backed up yet move without any sense of urgency, no concept of teamwork. Apparently they were all delivery drivers, poorly trained, closest thing to a leader was a veteran appearing man who came in to rotate pizzas, in his jacket without washing hands, then he made himself a sandwich and left.

The pizza took FOREVER!! While the two guys working spent all their time catering too and giving coupons too a group of 3 teenage girls. Giving them freebies, extras, and significant discounts...
 
Finally the pizza comes... There is only 1 jar of crushed red pepper in the house, unused on the girls table, I'm given packets for deliveries... The pizza is awful, doughy, undercooked full of unpopped bubbles it was lackluster and disgusting. It was so sad. I loved Venezia!! It was great, ALDOS IS NOT VENEZIA, Needless to say we took a refund and im typing this waiting for a pizza from nypd.

They announced the business of every nearby delivery, knockouts, yours was expedited quickly, but if you ordered a rectangular pepperoni to be delivered to the el rey theater..... Sorry to say but it sat for 10 min was reheated and brought to you... Dont eat here. Its gross.

data.title: driver trouble
data.text: I was not very happy with the service.  The driver backed in to our tree,  knocked down two rows of the bricks around it.   he hit pretty hard because moved the whole thing a couple of inches.  The ring of brick around this tree is about 2 1/2 feet tall.  and ten foot across.  its kind of hard to miss.      he then wasn't enough of man to come back to the door and tell us that he did it.   he just left it for us to find in the morning.     when I called the store they didn't seen to really care either because they didn't make the driver call and apologize or offer to fix it.   will not order from them ever again.   not good customer service.    not willing to spend my money with people who don't care.

data.title: Dirty, dirty.....
data.text: The first impression about the place went down hill starting with the door.... It was filthy!!! Don't know when was the last time it was cleaned. Also the chairs were so dirty, that make you think twice how the rest of the place is.... The staff is blah, no costumer service.... It is a shame, we couldn't enjoy the pizza the way we wanted to.

data.title: All time favorite in Rio Rancho
data.text: This has been our favorite pizza since the late 70's. Still very good and the prices are decent. The owner is friendly and  accommodating.
